place.name: Arroyo Quemado Transect 3
place.geographicDescription: Transect begins at the western edge of the hard substrate, nearly directly offshore of the river mouth (~200 m). Silt covered bedrock and small boulder substrate with little relief (0-0.5 m), some moderate sized areas of deep sand present along with Pterygophora and Diopatra beds. Depth is approximately 30'.
place.completeDescription: Transect begins at the western edge of the hard substrate, nearly directly offshore of the river mouth (~200 m). Silt covered bedrock and small boulder substrate with little relief (0-0.5 m), some moderate sized areas of deep sand present along with Pterygophora and Diopatra beds. Bumpers at 0 and 40m. Most markers are SS ¼” eyebolts with tubing. The 0, 24, and 40m have yellow rebar. Transect heading is 110-115 degrees.

verbatim.notesInfoReceived: 70-100 PTCA; 60% rock; no adult kelp; ~10 juv kelp; ~200 PTJ; DL, CYOS, red algae, MPJ, and PTL/PTJ common
Direction is an average over entire transect.
20-30% PTCA; ~70 kelp plants; 30% Rock; Lots of DL!
16m bolt not found during maintenance, might need to replace/find.
